body_content.explanation: having two axes (= real or imaginary straight lines going through the centre of a object that is spinning, or lines that divide a shape into two equal halves) :
examples: The polymer has biaxial orientation, stretched along both its latitudinal and longitudinal axes.
The glass has high tensile strength and can remain unaffected by biaxial strain.

body_content.explanation: relating to an axis that goes from left to right through the middle of a picture, design, etc., and another than goes from the top to the bottom:
examples: The flag has biaxial symmetry, so it looks the same when you turn it upside-down.
The parking garage had a biaxial layout, with an elevator near each of the four corners.
